alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 9:53AM EST until February 27 at 1:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio...Michigan... Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Pulaski, White and Carroll Counties. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Pulaski, Marshall, Fulton IN, Starke and Kosciusko Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, De Kalb and Defiance Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at Three Rivers affecting Elkhart, St. Joseph MI and Branch Counties. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. .Rises on area rivers occurred as a result of recent rainfall paired with maximized runoff from frozen ground and snow melt. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River near Ora. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect streets and homes in Monterey. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Thursday /7:30 AM CST Thursday/ the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Thursday /7:30 AM CST Thursday/ was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon and continue falling to 11.0 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
